sentence.Network_en: He was wearing cotton pants and an open-necked shirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他穿着纯棉裤子和开领衬衫。

sentence.Network_en: We are a stiff - necked people and a people of long memory.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们是个倔强的民族,一个善于记忆的民族.

sentence.Network_en: He had necked with his wife for long passionate hours.
sentence.Network_cn: 他和妻子卿卿我我地依偎了好半天.

entry.def: Your neck is the part of your body which joins your head to the rest of your body.

example.ex: She threw her arms round his neck and hugged him warmly...
example.tran: 她伸出双臂搂住他的脖子，热情地拥抱他。

example.ex: He was short and stocky, and had a thick neck.
example.tran: 他矮壮结实，脖子很粗。

entry.def: The neck of an article of clothing such as a shirt, dress, or sweater is the part which surrounds your neck.

example.ex: ...the low, ruffled neck of her blouse...
example.tran: 她的打褶低胸的衬衫领口

example.ex: He wore a blue shirt open at the neck.
example.tran: 他穿了件蓝衬衫，领口敞开着。

entry.tran: (瓶子、吉他等的)颈状部位，细长部分，颈部
entry.def: The neck of something such as a bottle or a guitar is the long narrow part at one end of it.

example.ex: Catherine gripped the broken neck of the bottle.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳紧握着破裂的瓶颈。

example.ex: ...cancer of the neck of the womb.
example.tran: 宫颈癌

entry.tran: 搂着脖子亲吻;相拥而吻
entry.def: If two people are necking, they are kissing each other in a sexual way.

example.ex: They sat talking and necking in the car for another ten minutes...
example.tran: 他们在车里又坐了10分钟，边说边搂着亲热。

example.ex: I found myself behind a curtain, necking with my best friend's wife.
example.tran: 我意识到自己在帘子后面吻着至友的妻子。

entry.def: If a horse wins a race by a neck, it wins by a very small distance.

example.ex: Cee En Cee went on to win by a neck from Leigh Crofter.
example.tran: 西恩西再次以微弱优势战胜莉·克罗夫特。

entry.def: If you say that someone is breathing down your neck, you mean that they are watching you very closely and checking everything you do.

example.ex: Most farmers have bank managers breathing down their necks.
example.tran: 大部分农场主的一举一动都受到银行经理们的密切关注。

entry.tran: (尤指选举中)并驾齐驱，难分高低
entry.def: In a competition, especially an election, if two or more competitors are neck and neck, they are level with each other and have an equal chance of winning.

example.ex: The latest polls indicate that the two main parties are neck and neck...
example.tran: 最近的一次民意测验显示两个主要政党难分高下。

example.ex: The party is running neck-and-neck with Labour.
example.tran: 该党和工党目前是旗鼓相当。

entry.def: If you say that someone is risking their neck, you mean they are doing something very dangerous, often in order to achieve something.

example.ex: I won't have him risking his neck on that motorcycle.
example.tran: 我不会让他冒险骑那辆摩托车。

entry.tran: 保全(某人的工作或声誉)
entry.def: To save someone's neck means to prevent them from losing their job or harming their reputation.

example.ex: He had enough friends in the right places to save his neck and cover up for him...
example.tran: 他有很多朋友能保全他，帮他打掩护。

example.ex: He said the President was making a last ditch attempt to save his own neck.
example.tran: 他说总统正在作最后的努力，希望保住自己的声誉。

entry.def: If you stick your neck out, you bravely say or do something that might be criticized or might turn out to be wrong.

example.ex: During my political life I've earned myself a reputation as someone who'll stick his neck out, a bit of a rebel.
example.tran: 我在政治生涯中敢冒风险、有点叛逆是小有名气的。

entry.def: If you say that you have something round your neck or around your neck, you mean that it is your responsibility and it causes you a lot of worry.

example.ex: No-one should start working life with a debt round their neck...
example.tran: 任何人都不该身背债务开始工作生涯。

example.ex: It's a legacy which will hang around the country's neck for some time to come.
example.tran: 这项遗留问题在未来的一段时间内仍将困扰这个国家。

entry.tran: 深深陷入，被卷入(麻烦、罪行等)
entry.def: If you say that someone is in some sort of trouble or criminal activity up to their neck, you mean that they are deeply involved in it.

example.ex: The black market was flourishing, everybody was corrupt, in it up to their necks...
example.tran: 黑市繁荣，每个人都已堕落，深陷其中。

example.ex: He is probably up to his neck in debt.
example.tran: 他很有可能债务缠身。

entry.def: Someone or something that is from your neck of the woods is from the same part of the country as you are.

example.ex: It's so good to see you. What brings you to this neck of the woods?
example.tran: 见到你真高兴，哪阵风把你吹来了？

means.word_mean: 1. having a neck or having a neck especially as specified (often used in combination)

auth_sentence.content: To have such a nice-stepping long-necked peacock for his daughter.
auth_sentence.res_content: To have such a nice-stepping long-necked peacock for his daughter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To have such a nice-stepping long-necked peacock for his daughter.

auth_sentence.content: The big, burly, bull-necked,...successful business man.
auth_sentence.res_content: The big, burly, bull-necked,...successful business man.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The big, burly, bull-necked,...successful business man.

auth_sentence.content: The pliosauroids were short-necked plesiosaurs with large heads and massive toothed jaws.
auth_sentence.res_content: The pliosauroids were short-necked plesiosaurs with large heads and massive toothed jaws.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The pliosauroids were short-necked plesiosaurs with large heads and massive toothed jaws.
